title: Ticket #2974: Support Eucalyptus 3.x in EC2 GAHP
description:
Eucalyptus 3.x does not recognize the InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior parameter in RunInstances, and refuses to start the instance. This parameter is required by EBS-backed instances to conform to Condor's semantics (until the Grid universe gains a stopped/suspended state), but does not apply to S3-backed instances.

After discussion with Jaime, the plan is to add a parameter to EC2_VM_START that determines whether or not the IISB parameter is sent. The grid manager can determine this from ATTR_EC2_EBS_VOLUMES in the job ad, which it already stores in each EC2Job as m_ebs_volumes; the changed call should occur at ec2job.cpp, line 529.
remarks:
2012-May-25 11:07:00 by tstclair:
The logic does not seem correct, the lack of ebs_vol's causes

InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior to not be set.

This will break ec2.

Use case of breakage, and ebs backed image starts up with no ebs volume attached. Shutdown will cause a "stop" not terminate which the customer will be billed for.

2012-Jun-08 16:42:32 by tlmiller:
That is, a given AMI is backed by EBS or not: it isn't up to the client to decide, so we can't tell based on anything in the job whether or not a given instance (image) is. We can either require a specific per-job attribute -- for backwards-compability, flagging when /not/ to set IISB -- which is ugly; we can add another URL type (https, x509, eucalyptus), which is also ugly; or we could ask (via DescribeImages), if the AMI in question uses EBS, which would be cleaner, but adds another round-trip.

2012-Jun-14 18:16:53 by tlmiller:
Decided to go with ugly option number 2, because it's a very small change.

2012-Jul-02 13:08:57 by tstclair:
option 2 looks ok
